title: What are the effects of pranayama and yoga on cognitive function and chronic diseases?
first_phrase: This text summarizes several studies on the effectiveness of pranayama and yoga-asanas for different health conditions. The study by Kyizom et. al evaluates the effects of pranayama and yoga on cognitive brain function in patients with type 2 diabetes. Other studies explore the potential benefits of yoga for patients with arterial hypertension, non-insulin dependent diabetes mellitus, asthma, and on lipid profile in healthy volunteers. The last article evaluates the effect of breathing exercises on patients with bronchial asthma of mild to moderate severity. Participants in these studies include Malhotra, Singh, Sharma, Madhi, Gupta, Tandon, Mizuno, Monteiro, Petersen, Ritz, Prasad, Madhavi Sunita, Sitarama Raju, Venkata Reddy, Sahay, Murthi, Prem, Sahoo, Adhikari, Saxena, and others.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the studies assessed suggest that incorporating yoga and breathing exercises, such as pranayama, can potentially have a positive impact on various health conditions, including hypertension, asthma, and Guillain-Barre syndrome. These techniques may also improve quality of life, lipid profiles, and reduce smoking cravings and withdrawal symptoms. Consider incorporating these techniques into your daily routine for potential benefits.
